summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed while he was a resident of Little St. James Island. It directs that his entire estate be transferred to the trustees of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust and appoints Darren K. Indyke, David Mitchell, and James E. Staley as executors, with Lawrence H. Summers named as a successor executor.

locations: Little St. James Island, St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will directs his entire estate to be transferred to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust'.
The will appoints Darren K. Indyke, David Mitchell, and James E. Staley as the primary executors.
Lawrence H. Summers is named as the successor executor if any primary executor cannot serve.
Each executor is to be paid $250,000 upon completion of probate.
Epstein was a resident of Little St. James Island in the U.S. Virgin Islands at the time the will was made.
